results.authors: By S'thembile Cele and Ntando Thukwana
results.headline: South Africa Elections: Jacob Zuma Has South Africa’s Fate In His Hands
results.summary: Jacob Zuma, who led South Africa for almost nine scandal-tainted years before being ousted by the governing African National Congress, may now play a major role in the country’s political future.

results.authors: By Amogelang Mbatha and Ntando Thukwana
results.headline: South African Election: ANC Gets 40% of Parliament Seats, Losing Its Majority
results.summary: South Africa’s African National Congress has begun talks with rivals to form a government following its worst performance since Nelson Mandela led it to power at the end of apartheid in 1994.

results.authors: By Ntando Thukwana, Antony Sguazzin, and S'thembile Cele
results.headline: S. Africa’s ANC in Alliance Talks, Ramaphosa Stays
results.summary: South Africa’s ruling African National Congress has begun talks with rivals to form a government after losing a parliamentary majority it had held since Nelson Mandela led it to power at the end of apartheid in 1994.

results.headline: 2024 Election Year: Trump Gets Convicted, Women Get Elected
results.summary: From Mexico to the EU, the “year of democracy” is becoming the year of the female politician.

results.headline: Toyota and Olympics Sponsorship Breakup Won’t Be the Last
results.summary: Now that corruption has become as much a part of the Games as the 100-meter and the decathlon, brands are thinking twice about their sponsorship.

results.authors: By S'thembile Cele, Ana Monteiro, and Antony Sguazzin
results.headline: South African Election: A Historic Rebuke for the ANC
results.summary: South Africa’s ruling party is girding for grueling talks with bitter rivals over the makeup a new government, after losing a parliamentary majority that’s stood for 30 years.

results.headline: EU Election: Orban Holds Major Rally in Budapest in Show of Force
results.summary: Tens of thousands of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s supporters gathered in Budapest in a show of force for the nationalist leader ahead of local and European Union elections marked by the emergence of a potent competitor.

results.authors: By Walter Brandimarte and Travis Waldron
results.headline: For Claudia Sheinbaum, Rise and Fall of Dilma Rousseff Is a Cautionary Tale
results.summary: Picture this: A highly popular president who can’t run for reelection seeks to cement his legacy by anointing a more technocratic female successor to become the country’s first woman president. That describes the rise of Mexico’s Claudia Sheinbaum in a nutshell.

results.headline: Moldova Picks General Prosecutor to Help Start EU Entry Talks
results.summary: Moldova’s president named a new general prosecutor after months of delays, part of a European Union-required reform of the judiciary needed to be able to start accession talks to the bloc.
